conclusion: Relevant principles for motion in one dimension are provided.
Acceleration as a function of displacement satisfies a(x) = v dv/dx.
Integrating from the starting position to any later position gives ½ v² = ∫₀ˣ a(x) dx.
From x = 0 up to x₁, the graph shows a constant acceleration a₀.
The integral of a(x) with respect to x over the interval from 0 to x₁ is a₀ x₁.
Compute the speed at x = x₁ using ½ v(x₁)² = a₀ x₁.
The magnitude of the object's velocity when the displacement is x₁ is v = √(2 a₀ x₁).
